org.grios.jwebcam

Class WebCamAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grios.jwebcam.WebCamAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.github.sarxos.webcam.WebcamListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler, java.util.EventListener

    public class WebCamAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.github.sarxos.webcam.WebcamListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler
    This class represents a WebCam adapter. It is used in order to select and configure some WebCam device that will be used to capture video inside your JavaFX applications. This class make an extensive use of jvideoinput pure-Java WebCam library and bridj.jar library. So, you must to reference jvideoinput-1.0.1.jar and bridj-0.6.2.jar libraries inside your JavaFX project. Otherwise, jwebcamfx will not function.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebCamAdapter()
      Build a new WebCamAdapter object that will be used to capture video from a WebCam device attached to your computer.

      • getWebcamPanel

        public com.github.sarxos.webcam.WebcamPanel getWebcamPanel()
        Returns the current JWebcamPanel object. Use this method in order to obtain a Java Swing control that will be displaying the stream produced by the web cam. In other words, this component is the webcam viewer that you want to put into your Java Swing-based Graphic User Interface. It can embeeded into a JPanel, JScrollPane or any container.
        Returns:

        Configure the com.sleepingdumpling.jvideoinput.Device object that represent the physical WebCam device.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - The object that represent the WebCam device that will be used.
        width - The video width that will be configured with the device.
        height - The video height that will be configured with the device.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the current WebCam that is playing. If not WebCam device is playing, no exception will be thrown.
